meanings.definition: To estimate (something) as being less than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She always underestimates the time it takes to finish her homework.
meanings.sent2: He underestimates the power of kindness in making a difference.
meanings.sent3: The cat underestimates the size of the box and tries to squeeze in.
meanings.sent4: His determination underestimates any obstacle in his path.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's smile underestimates her true joy in seeing her students learn.

meanings.definition: To think or guess that (something) is smaller, less important, or less likely than it really is.
meanings.sent1: They often underestimates the impact of their words on others.
meanings.sent2: She underestimates the value of her unique perspective in the team.
meanings.sent3: The robot underestimates the difficulty of human emotions.
meanings.sent4: His laughter underestimates the weight of his worries.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower underestimates its own beauty in the garden.
